answers.answer: Ask your primary doctor for a referral to an Endocrinologist, a doctor who trained and specializes with diabetes care and treatment, among other things. Discuss with the Endo about getting an A1c [HbA1c, HgbA1c] test, and having your thyroid and pancreas tested too. A misbehaving thyroid gland can cause hypoglycemia as it  disrupts your pancreases insulin production. Good luck.

question: my dctor did lab on me and said my blood sugar was 50 which was low and said  Ihad hypoglicima.I dont understand because abaout 3 months ago my level was 90 what would make it change so much. could something be wrong ?
title: low blood sugar without diebeties
